author: BBC News
title: Brexit sovereignty plan set out in Great Repeal Bill
description: Measures to end the supremacy of EU law come after the government formally triggered Brexit.

author: BBC News
title: Missing helicopter: Police launch Snowdonia ground search
description: Five people are still missing after a helicopter vanished off the radar while over north Wales.

author: BBC News
title: Insurer Lloyd's of London confirms new Brussels subsidiary
description: The 329-year-old insurance market says it has chosen Brussels for its new EU subsidiary.

author: BBC News
title: Oscars will still use accountant firm PwC despite envelopegate blunder
description: The firm that handles balloting is being retained, but its staff will be banned from using mobiles.

author: BBC News
title: Lord Heseltine: Brexit Britain relinquishes power
description: Tory peer and Remain campaigner Lord Heseltine says Britain has no leverage for Brexit negotiations.

author: BBC News
title: Syria: Living with war
description: BBC special coverage of a day in Syria where war may be simmering but is far from over.

author: BBC News
title: Cut sugar in cakes, chocolate by 20%, industry told
description: The guidelines for everyday foods are aimed at helping to reduce childhood obesity.

author: BBC News
title: Report shows computer delays in child grooming inquiries
description: It can take up to five months to analyse computers linked to alleged paedophiles.

author: BBC News
title: SpaceX set to launch 'used rocket'
description: California's SpaceX company expects to make a piece of history later when it re-flies a Falcon rocket.

author: BBC News
title: Trump travel ban: Hawaii judge places indefinite hold
description: The ruling means the president cannot enforce the ban while it is contested in court.
